{"post_stream":{"posts":[{"id":3411980,"name":"Jasmine Xu","username":"Xu-Jingya","avatar_template":"/letter_avatar_proxy/v4/letter/x/e5b9ba/{size}.png","created_at":"2024-07-30T03:10:33.409Z","cooked":"

We’re putting together a robot for our offseason match, but upon initial tests the krakens seem to shake violently and noisily even when we gave it less voltage and used an empty java program. All our krakens behave this way but our falcons do just fine. Does anyone have similar issues? Can anyone help us out here?

","post_number":1,"post_type":1,"posts_count":15,"updated_at":"2024-07-30T03:10:33.409Z","reply_count":0,"reply_to_post_number":null,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":92,"reads":364,"readers_count":363,"score":532.8,"yours":false,"topic_id":469301,"topic_slug":"kraken-shakes-violently","display_username":"Jasmine Xu","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"link_counts":[{"url":"https://www.chiefdelphi.com/t/tank-drive-unknown-problem/469304/2","internal":true,"reflection":true,"title":"Tank drive unknown problem","clicks":2}],"read":true,"user_title":"","bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":67357,"hidden":false,"trust_level":1,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"post_url":"/t/kraken-shakes-violently/469301/1","custom_user_title":null,"reactions":[],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":0,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null,"can_vote":false},{"id":3411981,"name":"Leo","username":"leo-les","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/leo-les/{size}/172390_2.png","created_at":"2024-07-30T03:11:18.289Z","cooked":"

Can you please share the code you are running, along with any videos of the kraken shaking?

I have sometimes mistakenly assumed that weird behavior was due to a software issue, when the actual cause was a loose screw. Not saying that’s your problem now, but it’s worth checking.

","post_number":3,"post_type":1,"posts_count":15,"updated_at":"2024-07-30T03:20:53.975Z","reply_count":0,"reply_to_post_number":null,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":0,"reads":348,"readers_count":347,"score":69.6,"yours":false,"topic_id":469301,"topic_slug":"kraken-shakes-violently","display_username":"Richard Wallace","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":"","bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":1549,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"I live for the details."},"post_url":"/t/kraken-shakes-violently/469301/3","custom_user_title":"I live for the details.","reactions":[],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":0,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3411989,"name":"Isaac","username":"isaacngkh","avatar_template":"/letter_avatar_proxy/v4/letter/i/e9a140/{size}.png","created_at":"2024-07-30T03:25:33.877Z","cooked":"

Have you tried spinning them with Phoenix Tuner individually? I would try use the Voltage Out mode in Phoenix Tuner to see if they spin normally. Then switch to Velocity mode. If the acts weird, then it is likely a PID issue.

I would also try to factory reset them in Phoenix Tuner.

// the WPILib BSD license file in the root directory of this project.

package frc.robot;

/**

  • The Constants class provides a convenient place for teams to hold robot-wide numerical or boolean
  • constants. This class should not be used for any other purpose. All constants should be declared
  • globally (i.e. public static). Do not put anything functional in this class.

  • It is advised to statically import this class (or one of its inner classes) wherever the

  • constants are needed, to reduce verbosity.
    */
    public final class Constants {
    public static class OperatorConstants {
    public static final int kDriverControllerPort = 0;
    }
    }

package frc.robot;

import edu.wpi.first.wpilibj.RobotBase;

/**

  • Do NOT add any static variables to this class, or any initialization at all. Unless you know what
  • you are doing, do not modify this file except to change the parameter class to the startRobot
  • call.
    */
    public final class Main {
    private Main() {}

/**

  • Main initialization function. Do not perform any initialization here.

  • If you change your main robot class, change the parameter type.

*/
public static void main(String… args) {
RobotBase.startRobot(Robot::new);
}
}

Did you test the motors individually before putting them in the swerve modules?

","post_number":8,"post_type":1,"posts_count":15,"updated_at":"2024-07-30T03:51:16.236Z","reply_count":1,"reply_to_post_number":null,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":1,"reads":260,"readers_count":259,"score":62.0,"yours":false,"topic_id":469301,"topic_slug":"kraken-shakes-violently","display_username":"Leo","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":"","bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":53083,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"3128 Alumni"},"post_url":"/t/kraken-shakes-violently/469301/8","custom_user_title":"3128 Alumni","reactions":[],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":0,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3412004,"name":"Jasmine Xu","username":"Xu-Jingya","avatar_template":"/letter_avatar_proxy/v4/letter/x/e5b9ba/{size}.png","created_at":"2024-07-30T04:25:48.482Z","cooked":"

We didn’t. However, we are testing them one by one now. The old Krakens are still shaking violently inside the modules. A new Kraken we tried outside the modules didn’t have the same problem though. All these krakens came from the same batch and are all brand new.

","post_number":9,"post_type":1,"posts_count":15,"updated_at":"2024-07-30T04:25:48.482Z","reply_count":0,"reply_to_post_number":8,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":0,"reads":256,"readers_count":255,"score":51.2,"yours":false,"topic_id":469301,"topic_slug":"kraken-shakes-violently","display_username":"Jasmine Xu","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":"","reply_to_user":{"id":53083,"username":"leo-les","name":"Leo","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/leo-les/{size}/172390_2.png"},"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":67357,"hidden":false,"trust_level":1,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"post_url":"/t/kraken-shakes-violently/469301/9","custom_user_title":null,"reactions":[],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":0,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3412005,"name":"Jasmine Xu","username":"Xu-Jingya","avatar_template":"/letter_avatar_proxy/v4/letter/x/e5b9ba/{size}.png","created_at":"2024-07-30T04:32:10.626Z","cooked":"

Thanks for your suggestion. However, we don’t have a PID now. We are using an empty program (which I have uploaded to this reply section). Spinning them with Phoenix tuner individually yields the same result. However, we tried connecting another kraken in outside the frame and it worked just fine. All these krakens came from the same batch and are all brand new. We are now taking a kraken away from the swerve module to try it outside the frame to see if the problem is the module or not.

","post_number":10,"post_type":1,"posts_count":15,"updated_at":"2024-07-30T04:32:10.626Z","reply_count":1,"reply_to_post_number":4,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":1,"reads":241,"readers_count":240,"score":58.2,"yours":false,"topic_id":469301,"topic_slug":"kraken-shakes-violently","display_username":"Jasmine Xu","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":"","reply_to_user":{"id":63578,"username":"isaacngkh","name":"Isaac","avatar_template":"/letter_avatar_proxy/v4/letter/i/e9a140/{size}.png"},"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":67357,"hidden":false,"trust_level":1,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"post_url":"/t/kraken-shakes-violently/469301/10","custom_user_title":null,"reactions":[],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":0,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3412009,"name":"Jasmine Xu","username":"Xu-Jingya","avatar_template":"/letter_avatar_proxy/v4/letter/x/e5b9ba/{size}.png","created_at":"2024-07-30T04:56:10.649Z","cooked":"

Update! Factory reset WORKED! thank you!

","post_number":11,"post_type":1,"posts_count":15,"updated_at":"2024-07-30T04:56:10.649Z","reply_count":0,"reply_to_post_number":4,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":0,"reads":216,"readers_count":215,"score":58.2,"yours":false,"topic_id":469301,"topic_slug":"kraken-shakes-violently","display_username":"Jasmine Xu","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":"","reply_to_user":{"id":63578,"username":"isaacngkh","name":"Isaac","avatar_template":"/letter_avatar_proxy/v4/letter/i/e9a140/{size}.png"},"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[{"id":2,"count":1}],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":67357,"hidden":false,"trust_level":1,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"post_url":"/t/kraken-shakes-violently/469301/11","custom_user_title":null,"reactions":[{"id":"100","type":"emoji","count":1}],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":1,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3412010,"name":"Jasmine Xu","username":"Xu-Jingya","avatar_template":"/letter_avatar_proxy/v4/letter/x/e5b9ba/{size}.png","created_at":"2024-07-30T04:58:08.864Z","cooked":"

Update! We fixed it by factory resetting the krakens! Thank you everyone!

","post_number":12,"post_type":1,"posts_count":15,"updated_at":"2024-07-30T04:58:08.864Z","reply_count":0,"reply_to_post_number":null,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":1,"reads":214,"readers_count":213,"score":62.8,"yours":false,"topic_id":469301,"topic_slug":"kraken-shakes-violently","display_username":"Jasmine Xu","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":"","bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[{"id":2,"count":1}],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":67357,"hidden":false,"trust_level":1,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"post_url":"/t/kraken-shakes-violently/469301/12","custom_user_title":null,"reactions":[{"id":"heart","type":"emoji","count":1}],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":1,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3412014,"name":"Isaac","username":"isaacngkh","avatar_template":"/letter_avatar_proxy/v4/letter/i/e9a140/{size}.png","created_at":"2024-07-30T05:28:00.237Z","cooked":"

Glad factory reset worked. I would note that a lot of the control requests (like VelocityVoltage) uses PID internally. You will need to config the PID in Phoenix Tuner or in the code. If you choose to use control requests.

Phoenix 6

Tuner Configs

Configs can be viewed, modified, backed-up, restored, and factory-defaulted via the Configs tab in Phoenix Tuner X. Tuner X configs page To apply a modified config, press the apply button (download...


(From CTRE Example project)

Seems like you are trying to produce the swerve code from Phoenix Tuner. The project should automatically config all the drive/turn motors correctly. Good luck

Make sure you’re running the latest firmware. Some of the early firmware releases had some issues here and there, but the latest firmware seems to be pretty robust.
